item.title: Leo's toxic rhetoric and an inner conflict
item.description:
in Self-Actualization

1) George Floyd was resisting arrest very much. Excessive force was used. Trial should occur to sort out the details. And I still support BLM. Yes, the Floyd case was a self-fulfilling prophecy of his fear. But that doesn't justify the excessive use of force. My take on Floyd is nuanced. I did not "victim shame" him.

2) Dating advice has a very specific pragmatic context. It is not spiritual advice and is meeting the guy where he's at and telling him what he needs to hear to correct himself.

3) I tend to make posts on this forum rather casually and sometimes flippantly, because I make thousands of posts. These are not carefully constructed rhetorical masterpieces with hours of research. I'm spitballin here. Sometimes the posts are sloppy or rough.

4) Sometimes my tone is obnoxious and arrogant. I will work on that in the future. You'll definitely see that improve as I grow.

All this QAnnon stuff -- is it aligned with the highest love and consciousness, or fear and resentment?

item.title: Facebook Bans All QAnnon!
item.description:
in Society, Environment, Government, Politics
21 hours ago, Preety_India said:

What do you mean? 

You mean that Facebook shouldn't be allowed to ban Qannon?

There should be a federal agency which sets ToS standards across all social media sites, with clear guidelines for bannable speech and an appeals court process.

For example, it should be against ToS to accuse people of being pedophiles without tangible evidence. As this is slander/libel.

Speech inciting violence or hatred or racial conspiracies such as "Jews controlling the world" should also be bannable.

Of course there will be many grey areas and devils will try to exploit and skirt the guidelines no matter what. It's a classic problem of how to police bad actors. But we already know how to do this: police department and courts.

We basically need an online police department and online courts for online crimes.

19 hours ago, Hansu said:

Banning them from Facebook does jack shit against their operation

You cannot compare 4chan and Reddit with Facebook. Facebook is far more mainstream and potentially damaging. 4chan is a niche site for toxic trolls and agnsty teenage anime fans. It's not mainstream at all.

Reddit is also pretty niche compared to Facebook, but even Reddit has standards. They will ban QAnnon at some point if they haven't already.

Banning from Facebook, YT, Twitter, and Apple is hugely important. If you're not on those platforms, you're basically a nobody. The Alex Jones ban was very effective at stopping his garbage from spreading.

There will always be toxic niche sites. What's important is the mainstream sites are safeguarded from viral garbage.

item.title: The Catch-22 of getting needs met
item.description:
in Dating, Relationships, Sexuality
11 hours ago, Max_V said:

Not being able to meet a need yourself causes neediness for it to be met.

Welcome to life in a tribe/community -- where we all rely on each other to survive. Without cooperation all of us would be dead. That's what it means to be human. Cooperation is a delicate balancing act.

Quote

Neediness repells people, and so in turn makes them not want to need your meets. And so I am left with this struggle of how to break out of this cycle.

You can cooperate with people without being overly needy. A lot of stuff you can handle yourself, but when it comes to getting a blowjob, well... that's where you cooperate

The way to break out of the cycle is stop thinking about it and start taking action to develop abundance. You can get very experienced with girls such that you no longer feel needy. You can also do inner work to raise your confidence and self-esteem.

You're right. There's no substitute for socialization. Stop over-thinking and go out and talk to girls.

item.title: Root cause of ‘secrecy’
item.description:
in Self-Actualization

It is a fear-based survival strategy that you developed as a child. Being secretive allowed you to hide ugly parts of your self from others, and therefore the light of consciousness. It is an ego defense mechanism that creates a sense of you vs other. At some point in your life, revealing too much probably led to you getting wounded. And you act out those wounds to this day.

It takes a lot of courage to air all your inner thoughts and feelings to the world without manipulation or conceit, as you will be challenged by others who will call you out on your biases, selfishness, and bullshit. People will also use this information against you. To manipulate and exploit you.

The ego-mind withholds information from others in order to gain an advantage in manipulating them.

Actually, it's a very big problem for you. It dominates your entire life in ways that are too scary to even admit to yourself. It makes you feel fundamentally inauthentic, scared, weak, and isolated.

item.description:
in Society, Environment, Government, Politics
51 minutes ago, dyslexicCnut said:

@Leo Gura Haha, the ol' ban hammer. I suppose that's one way to win an argument.

I don't care about winning an argument with you. Just don't act cnuty on this forum.

For someone so adamantly arguing for left-wing anti-racistic positions, you have the attitude of a right-wing 4chan troll.

Quote

In regards to this topic, I'm curious whether you would consider the "white supremacist" description of Proud Boys as classified by accredited US intelligence agencies enough to justify the terms' usage in reference to these extremists. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Proud_Boys#cite_note-SPLC-10

The lines between various right-wing nationalist and racist groups tend to get very blurry.

I basically agree with the Southern Poverty Law Center's initial characterization of the Proud Boys:

Quote

...the Proud Boys are self-described “western chauvinists” who adamantly deny any connection to the racist “alt-right,” insisting they are simply a fraternal group spreading an “anti-political correctness” and “anti-white guilt” agenda.

This is how the Proud Boys see themselves.

Of course left-wingers will see them differently.

You have to make a distinction between how people view themselves vs how you view them. You might actually learn something by taking their self-identification and self-description seriously.

item.title: Why not choose Psychedelics over Hospital treatment??
item.description:
in Serious Emotional Problems

@ucan99 Given the uniqueness of your case, no one will be able to tell you for sure how psychedelics will affect you.

The only way to find out is to experiment carefully.

I doubt psychedelics will just automatically cure you. But they might give you insight into your condition and offer some temporary relief and hope.

It sounds like your brain chemistry is not good. You should seriously research how to detox your brain. That is more likely to help you than psychedelics.

Psychedelics will not cure a toxic and dysfunctional brain chemistry, just like they will not cure a broken leg. You must identify and solve the root cause at its appropriate level. It might be material, or it might be spiritual. Don't try to fix material problems with spirituality, and vice versa.

You can always test psychedelics with very little risk at low doses. A 1/2 gram of mushrooms will not harm anyone.

item.title: Is Fluoride "Calcifying your Pineal Gland" a myth?
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
3 hours ago, Flyboy said:

She said she would NEVER drink bottled water, as it contains far more impurities than tap water, and that tap water is some of the cleanest water you can drink.

This is just absurd.

You can easily test the impurities level of your tap water and bottled water with a $15 water meter from Amazon.

Bottled water is about 20 PPM. Tap water is around 300 PPM, depending on where you live.

Tap water is not run through RO filters. Bottled water is. It would be super wasteful to run tap water through and RO filter at the city level. RO filters waste 3-5 gallons of tap water to produce 1 gallon of pure drinking water.

Hunting is not mutually exclusive to romance and love.

Dating can be done unconsciously or consciously, and many shades in between.

And don't forget, just because a guy doesn't get into pickup does not mean he don't abuse or manipulate women. He certainly will as he will be even more desperate and lacking the hunting skills. A starving limping wolf is more dangerous than a strong well-fed wolf.

Also, pickup is not merely about hunting girls. It's most about transforming oneself into a better man in order to attract and keep higher quality girls. In the end the guy will discover that tricking girls doesn't work, so the guy is forced to grow himself to get the best girls.

None of this makes much sense from the girl's perspective because you are not tasked with the burden of approaching. You should be thankful that you don't have to carry that burden because it's quite heavy.

Do some guys abuse it? Of course!

See, the thing is, women LOVE a strong guy. But they don't love the process which a guy must go through to become strong. Women only want the end-result of the work. Women expect that strength to be effortless, natural, and free, without any work. They don't want to know how the sausage is made.

Also, you should realize that what you call "real love" isn't real love. It is selfishness and survival. Women do not love men unconditionally. You are attracted to strong men who fit your survival needs. You are attracted to weak, needy, humorless men.

Men will love women unconditionally the same day that women love men unconditionally. Which is never. All romantic activities are highly conditional, biased, and selfish.

@Leo Gura
So what about those true things which cannot be directly experienced (for example other people experiences)?

If you can't experience them, why do you say they are true?

You need to seriously investigate what "true" means at all. What sense does it make to say a thing is true if you don't experience it?

Quote

It's an Absurd to think everybody doesn't exist and that I'm the only thing that is

Why? Isn't that what's literally true in your experience?

Maybe what's truly absurd is believing in the magical experiences of others which you have in fact never seen?

Why is it absurd to believe in unicorns, but not absurd to believe in "other experiences" when both are equally imaginary? Contemplate this.

You have to seriously question the assumptions culture has programmed you with. Consider the possiblity that you've been brainwashed into believing that other people are real.

item.title: Few Questions about concioussness
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
9 minutes ago, UnconsciousBastard said:

Hi , I'm following leo videos for a long time and i remained confused about some spiritual topics.
My questions are:
1. On some videos leo talks about consciousness as a quality you have, for example he says "your goal in life is to increase your level of consciousness, or you are not conscious enough, or you have to develop your consciousness and so on.

And on other videos he talks about it as the absolute truth, the fabric of reality, god , the thing that everything happens within or even the true nature of me.
So which one of them is right?

Imagine you are sitting in a room with the lights turned up to 1%. The room is light. But its hard to see clearly what's going on. Now imagine the light is cranked up to 1,000,000% and you see everything perfectly. The room is still the exact same light, but now nothing in the room is hidden from view.

Light = consciousness (in this analogy)

Quote

2.
It is safe to assume other people have their own consciousness as well although I'm not directly conscious of it.
so every person or living being has its own consciousness which contradicts what leo says. (that everything is one big consciousness)

No, that is not safe to assume. There are no safe assumptions in this work. Question everything.

Quote

3. But these things actually exist, I'm just not aware of them

Or maybe they don't. Maybe you're imagining them.

Quote

4.Why 2 people have 2 different concious expiriences? What is the thing that limits the concioussness to one place?
Is it the brain? If yes, once you kill the brain you kill the person and its game over and leo claims that's not true.

There aren't really 2 people. There is one single field of consciousness which imagines separation. This is almost impossible for the ego-mind to understand because your ego-mind assumes it is real and separate from everything else.

Quote

I feel like  since I started to follow this topics just added alot of confusion to my life , de-motivated me and generally had a negative impact.

This work can be very challenging. You must have a serious desire for knowing the truth.

And yes, it is very confusing.

Quote

I can't see how this is not just more theories and mind games.
Asking who am i or what i am did not lead me anywhere.
Asking questions about life didn't lead me anywhere to, so i get to some conclusions and then what? where is the amazing enlightenment.

help

Take a psychedelic.

item.title: Neither Monism, Nor Duality
item.description:
in Meditation, Consciousness, Enlightenment, Spirituality
1 hour ago, communitybuilder said:

When you guys ( @Leo Gura and @Someone here) become conscious that you're God... how do you know that this feeling isn't still an illusion? How do you know that, even though you're convinced that you are God / the floor of consciousness, that there isn't something behind that still?

Contemplate this question:

Assume God really did exist. How could God ever be sure he was God? Who would he ask? since anyone he asked would be himself. What if God asked himself but then lied to himself? Would that mean God exists but never knows he is God?

- - - - - -

God is not merely a feeling. It is TOTAL OMNISCIENCE of all of reality in one fell swoop. Imagine if you understood in one fell swoop how you designed every hair on your head and every molecule in your parents' bodies.

What you're not appreciating is that the Universe is capable of TOTAL OMNISCIENCE. It can know itself perfectly.
